intro: Bupleurum divaricatum f. elatius, commonly known as the tall bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a subtle, spicy scent. This variant is noted for its taller growth habit compared to other forms of Bupleurum divaricatum.
